SqlStatement.Comment: This is the statement that we use to add new schedule entries into our database
SqlStatement.Sql: insert into schedule (TaskName, TaskUrl, InputDocument, isActive, runEvery, LastRun, useInterval, RunAtTime, dowSunday, dowMonday, dowTuesday, dowWednesday, dowThursday, dowFriday, dowSaturday) values ( ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?)

SqlStatement.Comment: This is the statement that we use to update existing schedule entries in our database
SqlStatement.Sql: update schedule set TaskName = ?, TaskUrl = ?, InputDocument = ?, isActive = ?, runEvery = ?, LastRun = ?, useInterval = ?, RunAtTime = ?, dowSunday = ?, dowMonday = ?, dowTuesday = ?, dowWednesday = ?, dowThursday = ?, dowFriday = ?, dowSaturday = ? where id = ?

SqlStatement.Comment: This is the statement that we use to update the LastRun timestamp for a schedule entries in our database
SqlStatement.Sql: update schedule set LastRun = ? where id = ?

SqlStatement.Comment: This is the statement that we use to delete existing schedule entries in our database
This is the statement that we use to pull up all schedule entries in our database
SqlStatement.Sql: select id, TaskName, TaskUrl, InputDocument, isActive, runEvery, LastRun, useInterval, RunAtTime, dowSunday, dowMonday, dowTuesday, dowWednesday, dowThursday, dowFriday, dowSaturday from schedule

SqlStatement.Comment: This is the statement that we use to pull up a single schedule entry in our database.
SqlStatement.Sql: select id, TaskName, TaskUrl, InputDocument, isActive, runEvery, LastRun, useInterval, RunAtTime, dowSunday, dowMonday, dowTuesday, dowWednesday, dowThursday, dowFriday, dowSaturday from schedule where id = ?
